column4: all right, i've got a dual NVIDIA 8600GTS setup. i can't seem to get a working display driver for them. in the Hardware Drivers screen, there's absolutely nothing. when i installed the drivers from the nvidia site, i couldn't boot the graphical desktop, it took me straight to the console.
does anyone have an idea of what's going on?
i read somewhere that there's a bug with multi-gpu setups...
but i know i've gotten this working in the past
I'm running the same 2 video cards. Those drivers are broken
do you know an alternative? i know it's worked before...
alternative? switch back to hardy or jaunty? otherwise, wait. the install doesn't give me a working nvidia driver (modprobe says none installed), and a screwed up xorg.conf file.
oh, i'm already on jaunty
so youre running into the same problem on 9.04?
i believe so...
i haven't tried lucid yet
zuka save yourself the grief and wait for them to fix the nvidia drivers for lucid. it's a mess.
zuka, have you run the nvidia-xconfig command yet?
like i said, i've had it working before... i remember that i stopped using ubuntu for other reasons
not on this install. i'm afraid to. :P
don't run it with the gui up (gdm or kdm). make sure you stop it and run it from a term.
oh, ok.

under Hardy I could add an NTFS drive to my fstab and have it load with the system. Under Lucid I get an underpriviledged user error, and when I follow the instructions on the site, I get "Mount is denied because setuid and setgid root ntfs-3g is insecure". Anyone know a workaround?
right, how does one bring up the console?
oh yeah. thanks geekphreak
lol, what is the command to kill gdm?
I usually Alt+Ctl+2, log in, sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop (kdm if you're running KDE). then run nvidia-xconfig. then, restart your system.
